titleStmt.title: The Newlanders cure Aswell of those violent sicknesses which distemper most minds in these latter dayes: as also by a cheape and newfound dyet, to preserue the body sound and free from all diseases, vntill the last date of life, through extreamity of age. Wherein are inserted generall and speciall remedies against the scuruy. Coughes. Feauers. Goute. Collicke. Sea-sicknesses, and other grieuous infirmities. Published for the weale of Great Brittaine, by Sir William Vaughan, Knight.
titleStmt.author: Vaughan, William, 1577-1641.

titleStmt.title: The Newlanders cure Aswell of those violent sicknesses which distemper most minds in these latter dayes: as also by a cheape and newfound dyet, to preserue the body sound and free from all diseases, vntill the last date of life, through extreamity of age. Wherein are inserted generall and speciall remedies against the scuruy. Coughes. Feauers. Goute. Collicke. Sea-sicknesses, and other grieuous infirmities. Published for the weale of Great Brittaine, by Sir William Vaughan, Knight.
titleStmt.author: Vaughan, William, 1577-1641.

publicationStmt.publisher: By N[icholas] O[kes] for F. Constable, and are to be sold at his shop in Pauls Church at the signe of the Craine,

notesStmt.note: The words "Scuruy .. Sea-sicknesses," on the title page are in two columns with four brackets in the middle.
Reproduction of a photostat of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
